intro: Ichnanthus conjunctus, commonly known as the clustered wintergreen, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically dark green and slightly hairy. Its flowers are white and clustered in dense groups, blooming in early spring. Ichnanthus conjunctus is often found in moist, acidic soils in woodlands and along stream banks.
